value: Two Rustics Seated on a Bank Near Three Trees

label: Description
value: Near a clump of three large trees two peasants sit on a bank in conversation. The roof of a cottage, right and other cottages are seen through trees, left distance.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Cottage Near Mud Flats, With Distant Village In the Evening

label: Description
value: A cottage stands in the left foregound, with a ruined building at the right, overlooking mud flats and a distant village with windmills, as seen in the evening light.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Thatched Cottage by a Swamp in the Evening Light

label: Description
value: A thatched cottage stands behind a large tree, left, on the edge of a swamp; a church spire in right distance, seen in the evening light.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
A Village in a Broad Landscape in the Evening Light

label: Description
value: A village in a broad landscape is seen in the light of evening, while two others appear in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A cottage with two figures conversing at the door stands at left. Near by, a man with a pack on his back converses with a seated woman. A pool is in the right center foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Man Resting on a Grassy Bank Under a Large Tree

label: Description
value: A man rests against a high grassy bank by a large tree. A village with a church spire is seen through trees in the center distance. Plate reworded. Verso: Sketches of leaves (in pencil).

label: Physical description
value: Etching on paper, verso: graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Robert Bertie, 1st Earl of Lindsey

label: Description
value: In an oval stone enframement, surrounded by instruments of warfare, is a bust length portrait of Robert Bertie, First Earl of Lindsey (1572-1642).

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Buno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Head of a Young Man in Left Profile

label: Description
value: The head of a young man is seen in left profile. He wears a large flat hat with a feather, and appears to be in armor with a heavy drapery over his shoulders.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Neptine and sea nymphs and monsters are seen sporting over the waves; a closely knit composition.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the bust portrait of François de Nesmond, Bishop of Bayeux (1629-1715), shown in clerical attire, wearing a simple episcopal cross suspended on a ribbon. Below, his coat of arms in an oval enframement. At the four corners, hunting horns.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Farm buildings, some in ruins, in a broad landscape. A tower surmounted by a weathervane, left middle distance. Farm cart and fire, left foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Christ at the House of the Pharisee

label: Description
value: Christ is seen seated at table with six other figures. At His feet, the Magdeline is putting oil on them. Numerous other figures in the scene.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957; Acquired by Museum
Fountain of the Animals at Versailles

label: Description
value: A single spout fountain in a square basin fed by pairs of animals stands in a hedged-in area bordered by clipped trees. Figures in the foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In a mountainous wooded landscape, with classical buildings in the background are seated the Virgin with the Child on her lap, who reaches for a fig held aloft by the Mother. At the left, Joseph is seated against a bank reading.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Horsemen and dogs pursue a wolf through a forest. In the left foreground are two horsemen.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Louis Michel Le peletier de Saint-Fargeau

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the bust portrait of the Revolutionary figure, Louis Michel Le peletier de Saint-Fargeau (1760-1793), turned slightly to the right.

label: Physical description
value: Colored engraving, possibly aquatint on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Three female figures seated on clouds are shown making music; that on the left composes; the center one plays a lyre, and the one on the right is playing a kind of voila de gamba.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Two heavily robed standing figures, turned slightly to the left.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A barefooted young girl, a shepherdess, stands in flock of sheep spinning. In her right hand she holds a distaff, and in her left, a spindle. Beside her sits a small boy near a tree.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
The National Assembly at Versailles in 1789

label: Description
value: Interior at the Hall of Revels at Versailles, showing the meeting of the "Assembleé Nationale" at which privileges of nobility were forfeited.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In a landscape with ruined buildings soldiers, horses and caravans are seen at camp or on the march.

label: Physical description
value: Mezzotint engraving with etching in sepia and dark brown ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Dedication Page of a Suite of Cavalry Officers

label: Description
value: Grouped on and around a socle are pieces of armor and other instruments of warefare. In the background appears a cavalry march. On the socle, which bears a coat of arms, is a dedication to Gio. Michaele Hoffmann and a seven line inscription signed by the artist.

label: Physical description
value: Mezzotint engraving in dark brown ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: (A) Horizontal rectangular package. On the diaper patterned embossed face, the Wiss trade mark; underneath is printed "Over One Hundred Years of Quality".  (B) Smaller version of A.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Package Designers Council (Francis E. Blod, President).

label: Description
value: Four flowers and berries with plume-like leaves outlined in white against dark brown background.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache and graphite on pale blue laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Dense brown leafy pattern on black ground overlapped with green vines and small flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, graphite on white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Notes
value: Dense brown leafy pattern on black ground overlapped with green vines and small flowers.

label: Description
value: Two panels of multicolored flowers on yellow stems on dark brown ground separated by patterned stripes of purple and pink, bordered with yellow and turquoise.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on blue wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Two panels of multi-colored flowers with pink stems on dark brown ground. A yellow feather motif flanks floral arrangement. Patterned stripes of purple and pink, bordered with yellow and turquoise separate panels.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, graphite on blue wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

value: Pen and black ink, watercolor, over graphite, ruled border in yellow waterco Support: white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
Design for a Printed Textile: Floral Border with Islands on a Lake

label: Description
value: Flowered border enclosing small islands with buildings and violet trees.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on blue laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, gouache, watercolor, over graphite, ruled border in violet gouache Support: white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Shows a corner of a repeating design border. From left to right, a couple plays music, man in pink and woman in purple, sitting before a bush with colorful flowers; in the background, a body of water with some boats and an island with a castle in the distance; next, the couple plays with a dog; in the corner, the man offers the woman a flower, while she holds a box; lastly, the man holds a scroll and points it at the woman as she raises her hands. The border consists of areas of color, pink and purple and black with white zigzagging patterns.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
